relation: As said earlier, there are numerous Student Registered Organizations for almost all majors and interests. Each participate in their own traditions and community service programs.

There are activities happening almost everyday around campus. Whether it be cookouts, fashion shows, nutrition fairs, etc. There are plenty of Student Registered Organizations to join and meet people with the same interests as you. There is something here for everyone to enjoy.

The dining halls here provide a variety of options for students. They provide vegetarian options, full salad bar, and hot meals served everyday. The cafeteria has spacious rooms to sit and eat and keep clean at all times.

As a Resident Assistant in the residence halls here at SIUC, I see residence life as a great opportunity to meet other students and feel more comfortable with being away from home. The halls provide efficient space for students create a positive environment and provide multiple opportunities to get involved not only within the hall but around campus as well.

Faculty and staff expect a high standard of students that attend SIUC and they also hold a high standard for themselves as well. They work hard to ensure that each student is putting their best foot forward and using their skills to the fullest.

Make sure to get involved around campus while maintaining your school work. Getting involved on campus helps a lot with making new friends and adapting well to a new environment. Also, come here with an open mind and explore your options.

SIUC has a beautiful campus that is taken care of well. SIUC has a great Psychology program that I enjoy being a part of. SIUC provides me with various opportunities to expand my experience and knowledge in many fields.
pageTitle: Southern Illinois University-Carbondale (SIUC) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {305892=Every thursday in June and July have free concerts. You can bring alcohol as long as it is in plastic. No glass alowed. The concerts are either on campus in front of Shryock Auditorium or at Truly park., 235975=In fall of 2012 I will be moving in to Schneider in the East Campus towers. I have met my roommate for the fall and we get along great! I'm really looking forward to the independence and responsibility that goes along with moving out and living at school. The towers are set up so that each room is a suite joined by a bathroom with the room next to it. This makes things feel a lot more private as opposed to having a communal shower facility., 584120=As a Resident Assistant for 3 years, and a Resident for 1 years, Residence Hall Life has been quite an undertaking with changes happening each year. Living Learning Communities are a must for potential applicants and help network very quickly in the environment that you live in and could help you make life long friends in your field. Residence Hall Life has also started on becoming more inclusive to the LGBTQ community and will have a Pride floor starting in Fall 2014 for potential students who are allies or identify., 208007=The classrooms are not huge but they are not small. The lectors have mandatory small groups in which the TA teaches what you are learning in class, but in a smaller classroom. The teacher to student ratio is about 20:1 in small groups., 621854=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 575406=I live in the towers (Schneider Hall) which houses hundreds of students. In this environment it is often loud throughout the night and during days. The RA's do travel from floor to floor to make sure nothing too distracting is happening but students often learn the times they come and avoid being loud at these times. Another inconvenience is that there are no security cameras in the hallways. This has allowed many fire alarms to be pulled at all times during the night, this has become a trend in all three towers during the 2013-2014 school year., 533403=I have not run into extremely hard academics yet at Southern Illinois University, and I am a senior. I graduate in May 2014. Some majors I'm sure are rigorous, but my major, Paralegal Studies, is not rigorous if you try hard. My gen-eds were not hard., 100510=All of October, SIUC students celebrate Halloween by dressing up every weekend and go out and have fun. It is great seeing people dress up as different stuff every week. The weekend before Halloween it is called Unofficial and that is when most people go out in costumes to have a great time.}

You could win a free scholarship. textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students this school is great for students looking to attend a college in an almost rural area and but to far from home depending on where you live. Also if you would like to reside in an are that like a suburb or city, the campus offers those potions to students as well. Tips for prospective students Some tips for future SIUC students would be to create a facebook account because facebook is big here. I once was a faithful myspace user but i soon realized that without a facebook account, you WILL be missing out on a lot of events that is taken place around and outside of campus. Bang for the buck Being a siuc student i found myself spending a lot of money on food more than anything else believe it or not lol. The cafeteria food isn't bad it's just that you get tired of the same stuff. Am enjoying being here I love here in Carbondale, although the stores and other place where big events are held are long distances away it's fun here. I do recommend a car, but the campus bus is also a good alternative to. I joined the
